TopicTitle: Sir, Your Asteroid Has Been Delivered - to KSP

Articles.Content:
Class B Asteroid, found loafing around earth -- I mean Kerbin. Captured, placed into orbit, then landed at KSP.

Now I'm going to build a rover to grab it and move it closer to the VAB so the Kerbals can just sit in their offices and gawk at it.

I haven't detached the recovery vehicle parts yet. I'm afraid when I do it will just roll into the ocean.

The recovery vehicle:

 

 

Edited March 14, 2016 by RocketBlam

Asteroid, found loafing around earth. Captured, placed into orbit, then landed at KSP.

Now I'm going to build a rover to grab it and move it closer to the VAB so the Kerbals can just sit in their offices and gawk at it.

I haven't detached the recovery vehicle parts yet. I'm afraid when I do it will just roll into the ocean.

You went to earth? Cool. Thats what I call a redirect mission..
That is a sweet vehicle for it. But be sure to quarantine that rock for a while so as to be sure you didn't bring any alien organisms that may cause your Kerbals to build and pilot smarter.

Oops, hehe. Sometimes it just feels like home.

Yes, the Kerbals have been instructed to refrain from licking the object, although selfies while leaning against it are still allowed.

Also, you landed it in the space program, not the center? (KSP, not KSC)

Great job though!

I thought it was Kerbal Space Port?

KSC sounds like a fast food chicken restaurant to me.
